introduction: Savitri Ramasamy (born Savitri Nissankara 4 January 1936 – 26 December 1981) was an Indian film actress, playback singer, dancer, director and producer known for her works primarily in Telugu cinema and Tamil cinema. She is also known for her works in Kannada, Malayalam and bollywood. Savitri's first significant role was in the 1952 Telugu film Pelli Chesi Choodu. In 1960, she received the Rashtrapati Award for her performance in the Telugu film Chivaraku Migiledi. In 1968, she produced and directed the Telugu film Chinnari Papalu, for which she received the state Nandi Award for Best Feature Film (Silver). She often referred as "Mahanati" and "Nadigaiyar Thilagam".SavitriSavitri Actress.jpgSavitri in 1951Born4 January 1936Chirravuru, Guntur district, Madras Presidency, (present-day Andhra Pradesh, IndiaDied26 December 1981 (aged 45)Madras, Tamil Nadu, IndiaNationalityIndianOther namesMahanati SavitriNadigaiyar ThilagamSpouse(s)Gemini Ganesan(1952–1981)Children2AwardsRashtrapati AwardNandi AwardSavitri was honored with "women in cinema" at the 30th International Film Festival of India. Her Tamil works include Kalathur Kannamma (1959), Pasamalar (1961), Pava Mannippu (1961), Paarthal Pasi Theerum (1962), Karpagam (1963), Karnan (1963), Kai Koduttha Dheivam, Navarathri (1964), and Thiruvilaiyadal (1965). In 2018, Nag Ashwin directed the Indian biographical film "Mahanati" which chronicles the life of Savitri, essayed by Keerthy Suresh.
